measure.name: build_residential_hpxml
measure.modeler_description: The measure handles geometry by 1) translating high-level geometry inputs (conditioned floor area, number of stories, etc.) to 3D closed-form geometry in an OpenStudio model and then 2) mapping the OpenStudio surfaces to HPXML surfaces (using surface type, boundary condition, area, orientation, etc.). Like surfaces are collapsed into a single surface with aggregate surface area. Note: OS-HPXML default values can be found in the documentation or can be seen by using the 'apply_defaults' argument.

argument.name: hpxml_path
argument.description: Absolute/relative path of the HPXML file.

argument.name: existing_hpxml_path
argument.description: Absolute/relative path of the existing HPXML file. If not provided, a new HPXML file with one Building element is created. If provided, a new Building element will be appended to this HPXML file (e.g., to create a multifamily HPXML file describing multiple dwelling units).

argument.name: whole_sfa_or_mf_building_sim
argument.description: If the HPXML file represents a single family-attached/multifamily building with multiple dwelling units defined, specifies whether to run the HPXML file as a single whole building model.

argument.name: software_info_program_used
argument.description: The name of the software program used.

argument.name: software_info_program_version
argument.description: The version of the software program used.

argument.name: schedules_filepaths
argument.description: Absolute/relative paths of csv files containing user-specified detailed schedules. If multiple files, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: schedules_unavailable_period_types
argument.description: Specifies the unavailable period types. Possible types are column names defined in unavailable_periods.csv: Vacancy, Power Outage, No Space Heating, No Space Cooling. If multiple periods, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: schedules_unavailable_period_dates
argument.description: Specifies the unavailable period date ranges. Enter a date range like "Dec 15 - Jan 15". Optionally, can enter hour of the day like "Dec 15 2 - Jan 15 20" (start hour can be 0 through 23 and end hour can be 1 through 24). If multiple periods, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: schedules_unavailable_period_window_natvent_availabilities
argument.display_name: Schedules: Unavailable Period Window Natural Ventilation Availabilities
argument.description: The availability of the natural ventilation schedule during unavailable periods. Valid choices are: regular schedule, always available, always unavailable. If multiple periods, use a comma-separated list. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Unavailable Periods) is used.

argument.name: simulation_control_timestep
argument.description: Value must be a divisor of 60. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Simulation Control) is used.

argument.name: simulation_control_run_period
argument.description: Enter a date range like 'Jan 1 - Dec 31'. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Simulation Control) is used.

argument.name: simulation_control_temperature_capacitance_multiplier
argument.description: Affects the transient calculation of indoor air temperatures. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Simulation Control) is used.

argument.name: site_type
argument.description: The type of site. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Site) is used.

argument.name: site_shielding_of_home
argument.description: Presence of nearby buildings, trees, obstructions for infiltration model. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Site) is used.

argument.name: site_soil_type
argument.description: The soil and moisture type.

argument.name: site_zip_code
argument.description: Zip code of the home address. Either this or the Weather Station: EnergyPlus Weather (EPW) Filepath input below must be provided.

argument.name: weather_station_epw_filepath
argument.description: Path of the EPW file. Either this or the Site: Zip Code input above must be provided.

argument.name: year_built
argument.description: The year the building was built.

argument.name: unit_multiplier
argument.description: The number of similar dwelling units. EnergyPlus simulation results will be multiplied this value. If not provided, defaults to 1.

argument.name: geometry_unit_type
argument.description: The type of dwelling unit. Use single-family attached for a dwelling unit with 1 or more stories, attached units to one or both sides, and no units above/below. Use apartment unit for a dwelling unit with 1 story, attached units to one, two, or three sides, and units above and/or below.

argument.name: geometry_attached_walls
argument.description: The location of the attached walls if a dwelling unit of type 'single-family attached' or 'apartment unit'.

argument.name: geometry_unit_num_floors_above_grade
argument.display_name: Geometry: Unit Number of Floors Above Grade
argument.description: The number of floors above grade in the unit. Attic type ConditionedAttic is included. Assumed to be 1 for apartment units.

argument.name: geometry_unit_cfa
argument.description: The total floor area of the unit's conditioned space (including any conditioned basement floor area).

argument.name: geometry_unit_aspect_ratio
argument.description: The ratio of front/back wall length to left/right wall length for the unit, excluding any protruding garage wall area.

argument.name: geometry_unit_orientation
argument.description: The unit's orientation is measured clockwise from north (e.g., North=0, East=90, South=180, West=270).

argument.name: geometry_unit_num_bedrooms
argument.description: The number of bedrooms in the unit.

argument.name: geometry_unit_num_bathrooms
argument.description: The number of bathrooms in the unit. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Building Construction) is used.

argument.name: geometry_unit_num_occupants
argument.description: The number of occupants in the unit. If not provided, an *asset* calculation is performed assuming standard occupancy, in which various end use defaults (e.g., plug loads, appliances, and hot water usage) are calculated based on Number of Bedrooms and Conditioned Floor Area per ANSI/RESNET/ICC 301. If provided, an *operational* calculation is instead performed in which the end use defaults to reflect real-world data (where possible).

argument.name: geometry_building_num_units
argument.description: The number of units in the building. Required for single-family attached and apartment units.

argument.name: geometry_average_ceiling_height
argument.description: Average distance from the floor to the ceiling.

argument.name: geometry_unit_height_above_grade
argument.description: Describes the above-grade height of apartment units on upper floors or homes above ambient or belly-and-wing foundations. It is defined as the height of the lowest conditioned floor above grade and is used to calculate the wind speed for the infiltration model. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Building Construction) is used.

argument.name: geometry_garage_type
argument.description: The type of attached garage. Only applies to single-family detached units.

argument.name: geometry_foundation_type
argument.description: The foundation type of the building. Garages are assumed to be over slab-on-grade.

choice.value: Detailed Example: Basement, Unconditioned, 7.25 ft Height, 8 in Above-Grade, 9 in Rim Joists
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: Basement, Unconditioned, 7.25 ft Height, 8 in Above-Grade, 9 in Rim Joists

choice.value: Detailed Example: Basement, Conditioned, 7.25 ft Height, 8 in Above-Grade, 9 in Rim Joists
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: Basement, Conditioned, 7.25 ft Height, 8 in Above-Grade, 9 in Rim Joists

choice.value: Detailed Example: Basement, Conditioned, 5 ft Height
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: Basement, Conditioned, 5 ft Height

argument.name: geometry_attic_type
argument.description: The attic/roof type of the building.

argument.name: geometry_roof_pitch
argument.description: The roof pitch of the attic. Ignored if the building has a flat roof.

argument.name: geometry_eaves
argument.description: The type of eaves extending from the roof.

argument.name: geometry_neighbor_buildings
argument.description: The presence and geometry of neighboring buildings, for shading purposes.

choice.value: Detailed Example: Left/Right at 25ft, Front/Back at 80ft, 12ft Height
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: Left/Right at 25ft, Front/Back at 80ft, 12ft Height

argument.name: enclosure_floor_over_foundation
argument.description: The type and insulation level of the floor over the foundation (e.g., crawlspace or basement).

choice.value: Detailed Example: Wood Frame, Uninsulated, 2x6, 24 in o.c., 10% Framing, No Carpet/Subfloor
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: Wood Frame, Uninsulated, 2x6, 24 in o.c., 10% Framing, No Carpet/Subfloor

choice.display_name: Detailed Example: Wood Frame, R-11, 2x6, 24 in o.c., 10% Framing, No Carpet/Subfloor

argument.name: enclosure_floor_over_garage
argument.description: The type and insulation level of the floor over the garage.

choice.value: Detailed Example: Wood Frame, Uninsulated, 2x6, 24 in o.c., 10% Framing, No Carpet/Subfloor
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: Wood Frame, Uninsulated, 2x6, 24 in o.c., 10% Framing, No Carpet/Subfloor

choice.value: Detailed Example: Wood Frame, R-11, 2x6, 24 in o.c., 13% Framing, No Carpet/Subfloor
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: Wood Frame, R-11, 2x6, 24 in o.c., 13% Framing, No Carpet/Subfloor

choice.value: Detailed Example: Wood Frame, R-11, 2x6, 24 in o.c., 10% Framing, No Carpet/Subfloor
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: Wood Frame, R-11, 2x6, 24 in o.c., 10% Framing, No Carpet/Subfloor

argument.name: enclosure_foundation_wall
argument.description: The type and insulation level of the foundation walls.

choice.value: Solid Concrete, Whole Wall, R-10.2, Interior
choice.display_name: Solid Concrete, Whole Wall, R-10.2, Interior

choice.value: Concrete Block Foam Core, Whole Wall, R-18.9
choice.display_name: Concrete Block Foam Core, Whole Wall, R-18.9

argument.name: rim_joist_assembly_r
argument.description: Assembly R-value for the rim joists. Only applies to basements/crawlspaces. Required if a rim joist height is provided.

argument.name: enclosure_slab
argument.description: The type and insulation level of the slab. Applies to slab-on-grade as well as basement/crawlspace foundations. Under Slab insulation is placed horizontally from the edge of the slab inward. Perimeter insulation is placed vertically from the top of the slab downward. Whole Slab insulation is placed horizontally below the entire slab area.

argument.name: enclosure_slab_carpet
argument.description: The amount of slab floor area that is carpeted.

argument.name: enclosure_ceiling
argument.description: The type and insulation level of the ceiling (attic floor).

choice.value: Detailed Example: R-11, 2x6, 24 in o.c., 10% Framing
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: R-11, 2x6, 24 in o.c., 10% Framing

choice.value: Detailed Example: R-19, 2x6, 24 in o.c., 10% Framing
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: R-19, 2x6, 24 in o.c., 10% Framing

choice.value: Detailed Example: R-19 + R-38, 2x6, 24 in o.c., 10% Framing
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: R-19 + R-38, 2x6, 24 in o.c., 10% Framing

argument.name: enclosure_roof
argument.description: The type and insulation level of the roof.

choice.value: Detailed Example: Uninsulated, 0.5 in plywood, 0.25 in asphalt shingle
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: Uninsulated, 0.5 in plywood, 0.25 in asphalt shingle

argument.name: enclosure_roof_material
argument.description: The material type/color of the roof. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Roofs) is used.

argument.name: enclosure_radiant_barrier
argument.description: The type of radiant barrier in the attic.

argument.name: wall_type
argument.description: The type of walls.

argument.name: enclosure_wall_siding
argument.description: The siding type/color of the walls. Also applies to rim joists. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Walls) is used.

argument.name: wall_assembly_r
argument.description: Assembly R-value of the walls.

argument.name: window_area_or_wwr_front
argument.display_name: Windows: Front Window Area or Window-to-Wall Ratio
argument.description: The amount of window area on the unit's front facade. Enter a fraction if specifying Front Window-to-Wall Ratio instead. If the front wall is adiabatic, the value will be ignored.

argument.name: window_area_or_wwr_back
argument.display_name: Windows: Back Window Area or Window-to-Wall Ratio
argument.description: The amount of window area on the unit's back facade. Enter a fraction if specifying Back Window-to-Wall Ratio instead. If the back wall is adiabatic, the value will be ignored.

argument.name: window_area_or_wwr_left
argument.display_name: Windows: Left Window Area or Window-to-Wall Ratio
argument.description: The amount of window area on the unit's left facade (when viewed from the front). Enter a fraction if specifying Left Window-to-Wall Ratio instead. If the left wall is adiabatic, the value will be ignored.

argument.name: window_area_or_wwr_right
argument.display_name: Windows: Right Window Area or Window-to-Wall Ratio
argument.description: The amount of window area on the unit's right facade (when viewed from the front). Enter a fraction if specifying Right Window-to-Wall Ratio instead. If the right wall is adiabatic, the value will be ignored.

argument.name: window_fraction_operable
argument.description: Fraction of windows that are operable. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Windows) is used.

argument.name: window_natvent_availability
argument.description: For operable windows, the number of days/week that windows can be opened by occupants for natural ventilation. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Windows) is used.

argument.name: window_ufactor
argument.description: Full-assembly NFRC U-factor.

argument.name: window_shgc
argument.description: Full-assembly NFRC solar heat gain coefficient.

argument.name: enclosure_window_interior_shading
argument.description: The type of window interior shading. If shading coefficients are selected, note they indicate the reduction in solar gain (e.g., 0.7 indicates 30% reduction). If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: enclosure_window_exterior_shading
argument.description: The type of window exterior shading. If shading coefficients are selected, note they indicate the reduction in solar gain (e.g., 0.7 indicates 30% reduction). If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: window_insect_screens
argument.description: The type of window insect screens, if present. If not provided, assumes there are no insect screens.

argument.name: window_storm_type
argument.description: The type of window storm, if present. If not provided, assumes there is no storm.

argument.name: enclosure_overhangs
argument.description: The type of window overhangs.

choice.value: Detailed Example: 1.5ft, Back/Left/Right Windows, 2ft Offset, 4ft Window Height
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: 1.5ft, Back/Left/Right Windows, 2ft Offset, 4ft Window Height

choice.value: Detailed Example: 2.5ft, Front Windows, 1ft Offset, 5ft Window Height
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: 2.5ft, Front Windows, 1ft Offset, 5ft Window Height

argument.name: skylight_area_front
argument.description: The amount of skylight area on the unit's front conditioned roof facade.

argument.name: skylight_area_back
argument.description: The amount of skylight area on the unit's back conditioned roof facade.

argument.name: skylight_area_left
argument.description: The amount of skylight area on the unit's left conditioned roof facade (when viewed from the front).

argument.name: skylight_area_right
argument.description: The amount of skylight area on the unit's right conditioned roof facade (when viewed from the front).

argument.name: skylight_ufactor
argument.description: Full-assembly NFRC U-factor.

argument.name: skylight_shgc
argument.description: Full-assembly NFRC solar heat gain coefficient.

argument.name: skylight_storm_type
argument.description: The type of storm, if present. If not provided, assumes there is no storm.

argument.name: door_area
argument.description: The area of the opaque door(s).

argument.name: door_rvalue
argument.description: R-value of the opaque door(s).

argument.name: enclosure_air_leakage
argument.description: The amount of air leakage. When a leakiness description is used, the Year Built of the home is also required.

argument.name: air_leakage_type
argument.description: Type of air leakage if providing a numeric air leakage value. If 'unit total', represents the total infiltration to the unit as measured by a compartmentalization test, in which case the air leakage value will be adjusted by the ratio of exterior envelope surface area to total envelope surface area. Otherwise, if 'unit exterior only', represents the infiltration to the unit from outside only as measured by a guarded test. Required when unit type is single-family attached or apartment unit.

argument.name: air_leakage_has_flue_or_chimney_in_conditioned_space
argument.display_name: Air Leakage: Has Flue or Chimney in Conditioned Space
argument.description: Presence of flue or chimney with combustion air from conditioned space; used for infiltration model. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Flue or Chimney) is used.

argument.name: hvac_heating_system
argument.description: The heating system type/efficiency. Use 'None' if there is no heating system or if there is a heat pump serving a heating load.

argument.name: hvac_control_heating_weekday_setpoint
argument.display_name: HVAC Control: Heating Weekday Setpoint Schedule
argument.description: Specify the constant or 24-hour comma-separated weekday heating setpoint schedule. Required unless a detailed CSV schedule is provided.

argument.name: hvac_control_heating_weekend_setpoint

argument.name: hvac_control_cooling_weekday_setpoint
argument.display_name: HVAC Control: Cooling Weekday Setpoint Schedule
argument.description: Specify the constant or 24-hour comma-separated weekday cooling setpoint schedule. Required unless a detailed CSV schedule is provided.

argument.name: hvac_control_cooling_weekend_setpoint
argument.display_name: HVAC Control: Cooling Weekend Setpoint Schedule
argument.description: Specify the constant or 24-hour comma-separated weekend cooling setpoint schedule. Required unless a detailed CSV schedule is provided.

argument.name: hvac_control_heating_season_period
argument.description: Enter a date range like 'Nov 1 - Jun 30'. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML HVAC Control) is used. Can also provide 'BuildingAmerica' to use automatic seasons from the Building America House Simulation Protocols.

argument.name: hvac_control_cooling_season_period
argument.description: Enter a date range like 'Jun 1 - Oct 31'. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML HVAC Control) is used. Can also provide 'BuildingAmerica' to use automatic seasons from the Building America House Simulation Protocols.

argument.name: hvac_blower_fan_watts_per_cfm
argument.description: The blower fan efficiency at maximum fan speed. Applies only to split (not packaged) systems (i.e., applies to ducted systems as well as ductless mini-split systems). If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Heating Systems, HPXML Cooling Systems, HPXML Heat Pumps) is used.

argument.name: hvac_install_defects
argument.description: Specifies whether the HVAC system has airflow and/or refrigerant charge installation defects. Applies to central furnaces and central/mini-split ACs and HPs.

argument.name: hvac_ducts
argument.description: The supply duct leakage to outside, nominal insulation r-value, buried insulation level, surface area, and fraction rectangular.

choice.value: Detailed Example: 4 CFM25 per 100ft2, R-4, Deeply Buried
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: 4 CFM25 per 100ft2, R-4, Deeply Buried

choice.value: Detailed Example: 4 CFM25 per 100ft2, R-4, 100% Round
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: 4 CFM25 per 100ft2, R-4, 100% Round

choice.value: Detailed Example: 4 CFM25 per 100ft2, R-4, 100% Rectangular
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: 4 CFM25 per 100ft2, R-4, 100% Rectangular

argument.name: ducts_supply_location
argument.description: The location of the supply ducts. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Air Distribution) is used.

argument.name: ducts_supply_surface_area_fraction
argument.description: The fraction of supply ducts surface area in the given location. Only used if Surface Area is not provided. If the fraction is less than 1, the remaining duct area is assumed to be in conditioned space. If neither Surface Area nor Area Fraction provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Air Distribution) is used.

argument.name: ducts_supply_leakage_fraction
argument.description: The fraction of duct leakage associated with the supply ducts; the remainder is associated with the return ducts

argument.name: ducts_return_location
argument.description: The location of the return ducts. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Air Distribution) is used.

argument.name: ducts_return_surface_area_fraction
argument.description: The fraction of return ducts surface area in the given location. Only used if Surface Area is not provided. If the fraction is less than 1, the remaining duct area is assumed to be in conditioned space. If neither Surface Area nor Area Fraction provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Air Distribution) is used.

argument.name: ducts_number_of_return_registers
argument.description: The number of return registers of the ducts. Only used to calculate default return duct surface area. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Air Distribution) is used.

argument.name: ventilation_fans_mechanical
argument.description: The type of whole-home mechanical ventilation system.

argument.name: ventilation_fans_kitchen
argument.description: The type of kitchen ventilation fans.

argument.name: ventilation_fans_bathroom
argument.description: The type of bathroom ventilation fans.

argument.name: whole_house_fan_present
argument.description: Whether there is a whole house fan.

argument.name: whole_house_fan_flow_rate
argument.description: The flow rate of the whole house fan. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Whole House Fans) is used.

argument.name: whole_house_fan_power
argument.description: The fan power of the whole house fan. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Whole House Fans) is used.

argument.name: water_heater_type
argument.description: The type of water heater. Use 'none' if there is no water heater.

argument.name: water_heater_fuel_type
argument.description: The fuel type of water heater. Ignored for heat pump water heater.

argument.name: water_heater_location
argument.description: The location of water heater. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Water Heating Systems) is used.

argument.name: water_heater_tank_volume
argument.description: Nominal volume of water heater tank. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Conventional Storage, Heat Pump, Combi Boiler w/ Storage) is used.

argument.name: water_heater_efficiency_type
argument.description: The efficiency type of water heater. Does not apply to space-heating boilers.

argument.name: water_heater_efficiency
argument.description: Rated Energy Factor or Uniform Energy Factor. Does not apply to space-heating boilers.

argument.name: water_heater_usage_bin
argument.description: The usage of the water heater. Only applies if Efficiency Type is UniformEnergyFactor and Type is not instantaneous water heater. Does not apply to space-heating boilers. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Conventional Storage, Heat Pump) is used.

argument.name: water_heater_recovery_efficiency
argument.description: Ratio of energy delivered to water heater to the energy content of the fuel consumed by the water heater. Only used for non-electric storage water heaters. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Conventional Storage) is used.

argument.name: water_heater_heating_capacity
argument.description: Heating capacity. Only applies to storage water heater and heat pump water heater (compressor). If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Conventional Storage, Heat Pump) is used.

argument.name: water_heater_backup_heating_capacity
argument.description: Backup heating capacity for a heat pump water heater. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Heat Pump) is used.

argument.name: water_heater_standby_loss
argument.description: The standby loss of water heater. Only applies to space-heating boilers. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Combi Boiler w/ Storage) is used.

argument.name: water_heater_jacket_rvalue
argument.description: The jacket R-value of water heater. Doesn't apply to instantaneous water heater or space-heating boiler with tankless coil. If not provided, defaults to no jacket insulation.

argument.name: water_heater_setpoint_temperature
argument.description: The setpoint temperature of water heater. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Water Heating Systems) is used.

argument.name: water_heater_num_bedrooms_served
argument.display_name: Water Heater: Number of Bedrooms Served
argument.description: Number of bedrooms served (directly or indirectly) by the water heater. Only needed if single-family attached or apartment unit and it is a shared water heater serving multiple dwelling units. Used to apportion water heater tank losses to the unit.

argument.name: water_heater_uses_desuperheater
argument.description: Requires that the dwelling unit has a air-to-air, mini-split, or ground-to-air heat pump or a central air conditioner or mini-split air conditioner. If not provided, assumes no desuperheater.

argument.name: water_heater_tank_model_type
argument.description: Type of tank model to use. The 'stratified' tank generally provide more accurate results, but may significantly increase run time. Applies only to storage water heater. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Conventional Storage) is used.

argument.name: water_heater_operating_mode
argument.description: The water heater operating mode. The 'heat pump only' option only uses the heat pump, while 'hybrid/auto' allows the backup electric resistance to come on in high demand situations. This is ignored if a scheduled operating mode type is selected. Applies only to heat pump water heater. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Heat Pump) is used.

argument.name: dhw_distribution
argument.description: The type of domestic hot water distrubtion.

choice.value: Uninsulated, Recirc, Presence Sensor Demand Control
choice.display_name: Uninsulated, Recirc, Presence Sensor Demand Control

choice.value: Insulated, Recirc, Presence Sensor Demand Control
choice.display_name: Insulated, Recirc, Presence Sensor Demand Control

choice.value: Detailed Example: Insulated, Recirc, Uncontrolled, 156.9ft Loop, 10ft Branch, 50 W
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: Insulated, Recirc, Uncontrolled, 156.9ft Loop, 10ft Branch, 50 W

choice.value: Detailed Example: Insulated, Recirc, Manual Demand Control, 156.9ft Loop, 10ft Branch, 50 W
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: Insulated, Recirc, Manual Demand Control, 156.9ft Loop, 10ft Branch, 50 W

argument.name: dhw_fixtures
argument.description: The type of domestic hot water fixtures.

argument.name: dhw_drain_water_heat_recovery
argument.description: The type of drain water heater recovery.

choice.display_name: 25% Efficient, Preheats Hot Only, All Showers

choice.value: 25% Efficient, Preheats Hot and Cold, All Showers

choice.display_name: 25% Efficient, Preheats Hot and Cold, 1 Shower

choice.display_name: 35% Efficient, Preheats Hot Only, All Showers

choice.value: 35% Efficient, Preheats Hot and Cold, All Showers
choice.display_name: 35% Efficient, Preheats Hot and Cold, All Showers

choice.value: 35% Efficient, Preheats Hot and Cold, 1 Shower
choice.display_name: 35% Efficient, Preheats Hot and Cold, 1 Shower

choice.value: 45% Efficient, Preheats Hot Only, All Showers
choice.display_name: 45% Efficient, Preheats Hot Only, All Showers

choice.value: 45% Efficient, Preheats Hot and Cold, All Showers
choice.display_name: 45% Efficient, Preheats Hot and Cold, All Showers

choice.value: 45% Efficient, Preheats Hot and Cold, 1 Shower
choice.display_name: 45% Efficient, Preheats Hot and Cold, 1 Shower

choice.value: 55% Efficient, Preheats Hot Only, All Showers
choice.display_name: 55% Efficient, Preheats Hot Only, All Showers

choice.value: 55% Efficient, Preheats Hot and Cold, All Showers
choice.display_name: 55% Efficient, Preheats Hot and Cold, All Showers

choice.value: 55% Efficient, Preheats Hot and Cold, 1 Shower
choice.display_name: 55% Efficient, Preheats Hot and Cold, 1 Shower

choice.value: Detailed Example: 54% Efficient, Preheats Hot and Cold, All Showers
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: 54% Efficient, Preheats Hot and Cold, All Showers

argument.name: water_fixtures_usage_multiplier
argument.description: Multiplier on the hot water usage that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Water Fixtures) is used.

argument.name: general_water_use_usage_multiplier
argument.description: Multiplier on internal gains from general water use (floor mopping, shower evaporation, water films on showers, tubs & sinks surfaces, plant watering, etc.) that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Building Occupancy) is used.

argument.name: solar_thermal_system_type
argument.description: The type of solar thermal system. Use 'none' if there is no solar thermal system.

argument.name: solar_thermal_collector_area
argument.description: The collector area of the solar thermal system.

argument.name: solar_thermal_collector_loop_type
argument.description: The collector loop type of the solar thermal system.

argument.name: solar_thermal_collector_type
argument.description: The collector type of the solar thermal system.

argument.name: solar_thermal_collector_azimuth
argument.description: The collector azimuth of the solar thermal system. Azimuth is measured clockwise from north (e.g., North=0, East=90, South=180, West=270).

argument.name: solar_thermal_collector_tilt
argument.description: The collector tilt of the solar thermal system. Can also enter, e.g., RoofPitch, RoofPitch+20, Latitude, Latitude-15, etc.

argument.name: solar_thermal_collector_rated_optical_efficiency
argument.display_name: Solar Thermal: Collector Rated Optical Efficiency
argument.description: The collector rated optical efficiency of the solar thermal system.

argument.name: solar_thermal_collector_rated_thermal_losses
argument.display_name: Solar Thermal: Collector Rated Thermal Losses
argument.description: The collector rated thermal losses of the solar thermal system.

argument.name: solar_thermal_storage_volume
argument.description: The storage volume of the solar thermal system. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Detailed Inputs) is used.

argument.name: solar_thermal_solar_fraction
argument.description: The solar fraction of the solar thermal system. If provided, overrides all other solar thermal inputs.

argument.name: pv_system
argument.description: The size and type of PV system.

argument.name: pv_system_array_azimuth
argument.description: Array azimuth of the PV system. Azimuth is measured clockwise from north (e.g., North=0, East=90, South=180, West=270).

argument.name: pv_system_array_tilt
argument.description: Array tilt of the PV system. Can also enter, e.g., RoofPitch, RoofPitch+20, Latitude, Latitude-15, etc.

argument.name: pv_system_2
argument.description: The size and type of the second PV system.

argument.name: pv_system_2_array_azimuth
argument.description: Array azimuth of the second PV system. Azimuth is measured clockwise from north (e.g., North=0, East=90, South=180, West=270).

argument.name: pv_system_2_array_tilt
argument.description: Array tilt of the second PV system. Can also enter, e.g., RoofPitch, RoofPitch+20, Latitude, Latitude-15, etc.

argument.name: electric_panel_service_feeders_load_calculation_types
argument.display_name: Electric Panel: Service/Feeders Load Calculation Types
argument.description: Types of electric panel service/feeder load calculations. These calculations are experimental research features. Possible types are: 2023 Existing Dwelling Load-Based, 2023 Existing Dwelling Meter-Based. If multiple types, use a comma-separated list. If not provided, no electric panel loads are calculated.

argument.name: electric_panel_baseline_peak_power
argument.description: Specifies the baseline peak power. Used for 2023 Existing Dwelling Meter-Based. If not provided, assumed to be zero.

argument.name: electric_panel_service_voltage
argument.description: The service voltage of the electric panel. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Electric Panels) is used.

argument.name: electric_panel_service_max_current_rating
argument.display_name: Electric Panel: Service Max Current Rating
argument.description: The service max current rating of the electric panel. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Electric Panels) is used.

argument.name: electric_panel_breaker_spaces_headroom
argument.description: The unoccupied number of breaker spaces on the electric panel. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Electric Panels) is used.

argument.name: electric_panel_breaker_spaces_rated_total
argument.display_name: Electric Panel: Breaker Spaces Rated Total
argument.description: The rated total number of breaker spaces on the electric panel. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Electric Panels) is used.

argument.name: electric_panel_load_heating_system_power_rating
argument.display_name: Electric Panel: Heating System Power Rating
argument.description: Specifies the panel load heating system power rating. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Service Feeders) is used.

argument.name: electric_panel_load_heating_system_new_load
argument.display_name: Electric Panel: Heating System New Load
argument.description: Whether the heating system is a new panel load addition to an existing service panel. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Service Feeders) is used.

argument.name: electric_panel_load_cooling_system_power_rating
argument.display_name: Electric Panel: Cooling System Power Rating
argument.description: Specifies the panel load cooling system power rating. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Service Feeders) is used.

argument.name: electric_panel_load_cooling_system_new_load
argument.display_name: Electric Panel: Cooling System New Load

argument.name: electric_panel_load_heat_pump_power_rating
argument.display_name: Electric Panel: Heat Pump Power Rating

argument.name: electric_panel_load_bathroom_fans_power_rating

This represents the total of all other electric loads that are fastened in place, permanently connected, or located on a specific circuit. For example, garbage disposal, built-in microwave. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Service Feeders) is used.

argument.name: battery
argument.description: The size and type of battery storage.

argument.name: vehicle_type
argument.description: The type of vehicle present at the home.

argument.name: vehicle_battery_capacity
argument.display_name: Vehicle: EV Battery Nominal Battery Capacity
argument.description: The nominal capacity of the vehicle battery, only applies to electric vehicles. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Vehicles) is used.

argument.name: vehicle_battery_usable_capacity
argument.description: The usable capacity of the vehicle battery, only applies to electric vehicles. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Vehicles) is used.

argument.name: vehicle_fuel_economy_units
argument.description: The combined fuel economy units of the vehicle. Only 'kWh/mile', 'mile/kWh', or 'mpge' are allow for electric vehicles. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Vehicles) is used.

argument.name: vehicle_fuel_economy_combined
argument.description: The combined fuel economy of the vehicle. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Vehicles) is used.

argument.name: vehicle_miles_driven_per_year
argument.description: The annual miles the vehicle is driven. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Vehicles) is used.

argument.name: vehicle_hours_driven_per_week
argument.description: The weekly hours the vehicle is driven. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Vehicles) is used.

argument.name: vehicle_fraction_charged_home
argument.description: The fraction of charging energy provided by the at-home charger to the vehicle, only applies to electric vehicles. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Vehicles) is used.

argument.name: ev_charger_present
argument.description: Whether there is an electric vehicle charger present.

argument.name: ev_charger_level
argument.description: The charging level of the EV charger. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Electric Vehicle Chargers) is used.

argument.name: ev_charger_power
argument.display_name: Electric Vehicle Charger: Rated Charging Power
argument.description: The rated power output of the EV charger. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Electric Vehicle Chargers) is used.

argument.name: lighting
argument.description: The type of lighting.

argument.name: lighting_interior_usage_multiplier
argument.description: Multiplier on the lighting energy usage (interior) that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Lighting) is used.

argument.name: lighting_exterior_usage_multiplier
argument.description: Multiplier on the lighting energy usage (exterior) that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Lighting) is used.

argument.name: lighting_garage_usage_multiplier
argument.description: Multiplier on the lighting energy usage (garage) that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Lighting) is used.

argument.name: dehumidifier_type
argument.description: The type of dehumidifier.

argument.name: dehumidifier_efficiency_type
argument.description: The efficiency type of dehumidifier.

argument.name: dehumidifier_efficiency
argument.description: The efficiency of the dehumidifier.

argument.name: dehumidifier_capacity
argument.description: The capacity (water removal rate) of the dehumidifier.

argument.name: dehumidifier_rh_setpoint
argument.description: The relative humidity setpoint of the dehumidifier.

argument.name: clothes_washer_present
argument.description: Whether there is a clothes washer present.

argument.name: clothes_washer_location
argument.description: The space type for the clothes washer location. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Clothes Washer) is used.

argument.name: clothes_washer_efficiency_type
argument.description: The efficiency type of the clothes washer.

argument.name: clothes_washer_efficiency
argument.description: The efficiency of the clothes washer. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Clothes Washer) is used.

argument.name: clothes_washer_rated_annual_kwh
argument.description: The annual energy consumed by the clothes washer, as rated, obtained from the EnergyGuide label. This includes both the appliance electricity consumption and the energy required for water heating. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Clothes Washer) is used.

argument.name: clothes_washer_label_electric_rate
argument.description: The annual energy consumed by the clothes washer, as rated, obtained from the EnergyGuide label. This includes both the appliance electricity consumption and the energy required for water heating. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Clothes Washer) is used.

argument.name: clothes_washer_label_gas_rate
argument.description: The annual energy consumed by the clothes washer, as rated, obtained from the EnergyGuide label. This includes both the appliance electricity consumption and the energy required for water heating. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Clothes Washer) is used.

argument.name: clothes_washer_label_annual_gas_cost
argument.display_name: Clothes Washer: Label Annual Cost with Gas DHW
argument.description: The annual cost of using the system under test conditions. Input is obtained from the EnergyGuide label. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Clothes Washer) is used.

argument.name: clothes_washer_label_usage
argument.description: The clothes washer loads per week. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Clothes Washer) is used.

argument.name: clothes_washer_capacity
argument.description: Volume of the washer drum. Obtained from the EnergyStar website or the manufacturer's literature. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Clothes Washer) is used.

argument.name: clothes_washer_usage_multiplier
argument.description: Multiplier on the clothes washer energy and hot water usage that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Clothes Washer) is used.

argument.name: clothes_dryer_present
argument.description: Whether there is a clothes dryer present.

argument.name: clothes_dryer_location
argument.description: The space type for the clothes dryer location. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Clothes Dryer) is used.

argument.name: clothes_dryer_fuel_type
argument.description: Type of fuel used by the clothes dryer.

argument.name: clothes_dryer_drying_method
argument.description: The method of drying used by the clothes dryer. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Clothes Dryer) is used.

argument.name: clothes_dryer_efficiency_type
argument.description: The efficiency type of the clothes dryer.

argument.name: clothes_dryer_efficiency
argument.description: The efficiency of the clothes dryer. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Clothes Dryer) is used.

argument.name: clothes_dryer_usage_multiplier
argument.description: Multiplier on the clothes dryer energy usage that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Clothes Dryer) is used.

argument.name: dishwasher_present

argument.name: dishwasher_location
argument.description: The space type for the dishwasher location. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Dishwasher) is used.

argument.name: dishwasher_efficiency_type
argument.description: The efficiency type of dishwasher.

argument.name: dishwasher_efficiency
argument.description: The efficiency of the dishwasher. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Dishwasher) is used.

argument.name: dishwasher_label_electric_rate
argument.description: The label electric rate of the dishwasher. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Dishwasher) is used.

argument.name: dishwasher_label_gas_rate
argument.description: The label gas rate of the dishwasher. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Dishwasher) is used.

argument.name: dishwasher_label_annual_gas_cost
argument.description: The label annual gas cost of the dishwasher. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Dishwasher) is used.

argument.name: dishwasher_label_usage
argument.description: The dishwasher loads per week. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Dishwasher) is used.

argument.name: dishwasher_place_setting_capacity
argument.description: The number of place settings for the unit. Data obtained from manufacturer's literature. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Dishwasher) is used.

argument.name: dishwasher_usage_multiplier
argument.description: Multiplier on the dishwasher energy usage that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Dishwasher) is used.

argument.name: refrigerator_present

argument.name: refrigerator_location
argument.description: The space type for the refrigerator location. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Refrigerators) is used.

argument.name: refrigerator_rated_annual_kwh
argument.description: The EnergyGuide rated annual energy consumption for a refrigerator. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Refrigerators) is used.

argument.name: refrigerator_usage_multiplier
argument.description: Multiplier on the refrigerator energy usage that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Refrigerators) is used.

argument.description: The space type for the extra refrigerator location. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Refrigerators) is used.

argument.name: extra_refrigerator_rated_annual_kwh
argument.description: The EnergyGuide rated annual energy consumption for an extra refrigerator. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Refrigerators) is used.

argument.name: extra_refrigerator_usage_multiplier
argument.description: Multiplier on the extra refrigerator energy usage that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Refrigerators) is used.

argument.name: freezer_present

argument.name: freezer_location
argument.description: The space type for the freezer location. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Freezers) is used.

argument.name: freezer_rated_annual_kwh
argument.description: The EnergyGuide rated annual energy consumption for a freezer. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Freezers) is used.

argument.name: freezer_usage_multiplier
argument.description: Multiplier on the freezer energy usage that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Freezers) is used.

argument.description: The space type for the cooking range/oven location. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Cooking Range/Oven) is used.

argument.description: Whether the cooking range is induction. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Cooking Range/Oven) is used.

argument.description: The type of ceiling fans.

argument.name: misc_television
argument.description: The amount of television usage, relative to the national average.

argument.name: misc_plug_loads
argument.description: The amount of additional plug load usage, relative to the national average.

argument.name: misc_well_pump
argument.description: The amount of well pump usage, relative to the national average.

argument.name: misc_plug_loads_vehicle_present
argument.description: Whether there is an electric vehicle.

argument.name: misc_plug_loads_vehicle_annual_kwh
argument.display_name: Misc Plug Loads: Vehicle Annual kWh
argument.description: The annual energy consumption of the electric vehicle plug loads. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Plug Loads) is used.

argument.name: misc_plug_loads_vehicle_usage_multiplier
argument.display_name: Misc Plug Loads: Vehicle Usage Multiplier
argument.description: Multiplier on the electric vehicle energy usage that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Plug Loads) is used.

argument.name: misc_grill
argument.description: The amount of outdoor gas grill usage, relative to the national average.

argument.name: misc_lighting
argument.description: The amount of gas lighting usage, relative to the national average.

argument.name: misc_fireplace
argument.description: The amount of fireplace usage, relative to the national average. Fireplaces can also be specified as heating systems that meet a portion of the heating load.

argument.name: pool_present
argument.description: Whether there is a pool.

argument.name: pool_pump_annual_kwh
argument.description: The annual energy consumption of the pool pump. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Pool Pump) is used.

argument.name: pool_pump_usage_multiplier
argument.description: Multiplier on the pool pump energy usage that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Pool Pump) is used.

argument.name: pool_heater_type
argument.description: The type of pool heater. Use 'none' if there is no pool heater.

argument.name: pool_heater_annual_kwh
argument.description: The annual energy consumption of the electric resistance pool heater. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Pool Heater) is used.

argument.name: pool_heater_annual_therm
argument.description: The annual energy consumption of the gas fired pool heater. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Pool Heater) is used.

argument.name: pool_heater_usage_multiplier
argument.description: Multiplier on the pool heater energy usage that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Pool Heater) is used.

argument.name: permanent_spa_pump_usage_multiplier
argument.description: Multiplier on the permanent spa pump energy usage that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Permanent Spa Pump) is used.

argument.name: permanent_spa_heater_type
argument.description: The type of permanent spa heater. Use 'none' if there is no permanent spa heater.

argument.name: permanent_spa_heater_annual_kwh
argument.description: The annual energy consumption of the electric resistance permanent spa heater. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Permanent Spa Heater) is used.

argument.name: permanent_spa_heater_annual_therm
argument.description: The annual energy consumption of the gas fired permanent spa heater. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Permanent Spa Heater) is used.

argument.name: permanent_spa_heater_usage_multiplier
argument.description: Multiplier on the permanent spa heater energy usage that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Permanent Spa Heater) is used.

argument.name: emissions_scenario_names
argument.description: Names of emissions scenarios. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list. If not provided, no emissions scenarios are calculated.

argument.name: emissions_types
argument.description: Types of emissions (e.g., CO2e, NOx, etc.). If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: emissions_electricity_units
argument.description: Electricity emissions factors units. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list. Only lb/MWh and kg/MWh are allowed.

argument.name: emissions_electricity_values_or_filepaths
argument.display_name: Emissions: Electricity Values or File Paths
argument.description: Electricity emissions factors values, specified as either an annual factor or an absolute/relative path to a file with hourly factors. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: emissions_electricity_number_of_header_rows
argument.display_name: Emissions: Electricity Files Number of Header Rows
argument.description: The number of header rows in the electricity emissions factor file. Only applies when an electricity filepath is used. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: emissions_electricity_column_numbers
argument.description: The column number in the electricity emissions factor file. Only applies when an electricity filepath is used. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: emissions_fossil_fuel_units
argument.description: Fossil fuel emissions factors units. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list. Only lb/MBtu and kg/MBtu are allowed.

argument.name: emissions_natural_gas_values
argument.description: Natural gas emissions factors values, specified as an annual factor. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: emissions_propane_values
argument.description: Propane emissions factors values, specified as an annual factor. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: emissions_fuel_oil_values
argument.description: Fuel oil emissions factors values, specified as an annual factor. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: emissions_coal_values
argument.description: Coal emissions factors values, specified as an annual factor. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: emissions_wood_values
argument.description: Wood emissions factors values, specified as an annual factor. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: emissions_wood_pellets_values
argument.description: Wood pellets emissions factors values, specified as an annual factor. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_scenario_names
argument.description: Names of utility bill scenarios. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list. If not provided, no utility bills scenarios are calculated.

argument.name: utility_bill_electricity_filepaths
argument.description: Electricity tariff file specified as an absolute/relative path to a file with utility rate structure information. Tariff file must be formatted to OpenEI API version 7. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_electricity_fixed_charges
argument.description: Electricity utility bill monthly fixed charges. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_natural_gas_fixed_charges
argument.display_name: Utility Bills: Natural Gas Fixed Charges
argument.description: Natural gas utility bill monthly fixed charges. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_propane_fixed_charges
argument.description: Propane utility bill monthly fixed charges. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_fuel_oil_fixed_charges
argument.display_name: Utility Bills: Fuel Oil Fixed Charges
argument.description: Fuel oil utility bill monthly fixed charges. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_coal_fixed_charges
argument.description: Coal utility bill monthly fixed charges. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_wood_fixed_charges
argument.description: Wood utility bill monthly fixed charges. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_wood_pellets_fixed_charges
argument.display_name: Utility Bills: Wood Pellets Fixed Charges
argument.description: Wood pellets utility bill monthly fixed charges. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_electricity_marginal_rates
argument.description: Electricity utility bill marginal rates. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_natural_gas_marginal_rates
argument.display_name: Utility Bills: Natural Gas Marginal Rates
argument.description: Natural gas utility bill marginal rates. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_propane_marginal_rates
argument.description: Propane utility bill marginal rates. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_fuel_oil_marginal_rates
argument.display_name: Utility Bills: Fuel Oil Marginal Rates
argument.description: Fuel oil utility bill marginal rates. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_coal_marginal_rates
argument.description: Coal utility bill marginal rates. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_wood_marginal_rates
argument.description: Wood utility bill marginal rates. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_wood_pellets_marginal_rates
argument.display_name: Utility Bills: Wood Pellets Marginal Rates
argument.description: Wood pellets utility bill marginal rates. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_pv_compensation_types
argument.description: Utility bill PV compensation types. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_pv_net_metering_annual_excess_sellback_rate_types
argument.display_name: Utility Bills: PV Net Metering Annual Excess Sellback Rate Types
argument.description: Utility bill PV net metering annual excess sellback rate types. Only applies if the PV compensation type is 'NetMetering'. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_pv_net_metering_annual_excess_sellback_rates
argument.display_name: Utility Bills: PV Net Metering Annual Excess Sellback Rates
argument.description: Utility bill PV net metering annual excess sellback rates. Only applies if the PV compensation type is 'NetMetering' and the PV annual excess sellback rate type is 'User-Specified'. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_pv_feed_in_tariff_rates
argument.display_name: Utility Bills: PV Feed-In Tariff Rates
argument.description: Utility bill PV annual full/gross feed-in tariff rates. Only applies if the PV compensation type is 'FeedInTariff'. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_pv_monthly_grid_connection_fee_units
argument.display_name: Utility Bills: PV Monthly Grid Connection Fee Units
argument.description: Utility bill PV monthly grid connection fee units. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_pv_monthly_grid_connection_fees
argument.display_name: Utility Bills: PV Monthly Grid Connection Fees
argument.description: Utility bill PV monthly grid connection fees. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: additional_properties
argument.description: Additional properties specified as key-value pairs (i.e., key=value). If multiple additional properties, use a |-separated list. For example, 'LowIncome=false|Remodeled|Description=2-story home in Denver'. These properties will be stored in the HPXML file under /HPXML/SoftwareInfo/extension/AdditionalProperties.

argument.name: combine_like_surfaces
argument.description: If true, combines like surfaces to simplify the HPXML file generated.

argument.name: apply_defaults
argument.description: If true, applies OS-HPXML default values to the HPXML output file. Setting to true will also force validation of the HPXML output file before applying OS-HPXML default values.

argument.name: apply_validation
argument.description: If true, validates the HPXML output file. Set to false for faster performance. Note that validation is not needed if the HPXML file will be validated downstream (e.g., via the HPXMLtoOpenStudio measure).
